section.title: <xar:element />
section.t: Generates a named xml element in the output stream.

Generating dynamic tags in output has always been a special trick of the trade. Since xml uses < and > as special characters, you cant just surround some variable containing the tag name with those characters and expect it to work. (i.e. <$the_tagname /> is invalid, so you'd have to revert to <$the_tagname /> to produce the desired effect.) For obvious reasons, that is less than ideal.

The xar:element tag solves the above situation. By specifiying what should be generated in the output stream (not unlike the xsl:element tag in XSLT) in a dedicated tag, we capture the intent in a structured and valid syntax.
This element is often used with the xar:attribute tag, which creates attributes in the active parent element in a similar way. See the section xar:attribute for its syntax and uses.

t.t: Required attribute to name the element to be created

t.artwork:
<xar:element name="custom"/> Produces: <custom />
<xar:element name="custom"> Contains child content </xar:element> Produces: <custom> Contains child content </custom>
